channel.title: Gift Cards
channel.description:
So, apparently there is this kid with legitimate proof that he "hacked" or found a bug in Visa gift cards. Let's put it this way.
Game coins = .10/per coin So every 10 coins is $1.00 USD 100 - $10 USD 1000 - $100 USD Alright, we get the picture.
So, this person purchased a $25.00 USD Visa Gift Card, and apparently was able to purchase more then the limit? He bought about 1000 game coins (which is $100 USD) with a $25.00 USD card. No clue how, but maybe you guys might have a suggestion? I am considering it is illegal...abusing a bug :3.
If I didn't explain it enough, tell me. I'll explain it more thoroughly.

item.title: Gift Cards
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

So, apparently there is this kid with legitimate proof that he “hacked” or found a bug in Visa gift cards. Let’s put it this way.

Game coins = .10/per coin
So every 10 coins is $1.00 USD
100 - $10 USD
1000 - $100 USD
Alright, we get the picture.

So, this person purchased a $25.00 USD Visa Gift Card, and apparently was able to purchase more then the limit? He bought about 1000 game coins (which is $100 USD) with a $25.00 USD card. No clue how, but maybe you guys might have a suggestion? I am considering it is illegal…abusing a bug :3.

If I didn’t explain it enough, tell me. I’ll explain it more thoroughly.
